explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 3 because of its flash point: 45degC

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains P-O bonds as chemical groups with self-reactive properties present.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Based on that aqueous solubility is measured (ICSC (2002), SRC (2005), HSDB (2005)), it is judged that it is stable in the water.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though organic compounds containing oxygen chemically bonded to phosphorus.

acute_toxicity_oral.classification: Mixture: Category 1, O-: Category 1, S-: Category 1
acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Mixture: It was set as Category 1 based on LD50= 2.5mg/kg calculated from six date of rat LD50 value (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PATTY (5th, 2001) vol.7, PDS (1987)). O-object: It was set as Category 1 based on LD50= 1.5mg/kg calculated from four data of rat LD50 values (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PATTY (5th, 2001)). S-object: It was set as Category 1 based on LD50= 1.5mg/kg calculated froom five data of rat LD50 value (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.classification: Mixture: Category 1, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Mixture: It was set as Category 1 based on rat LD50= 8.2mg/kg (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PDS (1987)). O-body: no data. S-body: no data.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.classification: Mixture: Classification not possible, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Mixture: no data available; O-, S-: no data available

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.classification: Mixture: Category 1, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since the this vapor saturated vapor pressure of the mixture: material is 0.297ppm (0.003mg/L), it is thought that the inhalation study was done in mist. It was set as Category 1 based on LC50 = 0.0439mg/L calculated from four data (ACGIH (2002), PATTY (5th, 2001)) of rat LC50 value. O-body: datum without. S-body: datum without.

skin_corrosion_irritation.classification: Mixture: Classification not possible, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Mixture: no data. O-body: no data. S-body: no data.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.classification: Mixture: Category 2A-2B, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Mixtures: Based on the statement (HSDB (2005) that in humans redness, hurt in humans (ICSC (J), (2002), blurred visions and tearing are seen, it was set as Category 2A-2B. O-body: No data S-body: No data

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Mixture:No data. O-<substance>: No data. S-<substance>: No data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Mixture:No data. O-<substance>: No data. S-<substance>: No data.

carcinogenicity.classification: Mixture: Category 2, O-: Not classified, S-: Classification not possible
carcinogenicity.rationale: Compound : Since there are no results of human generation epidemiology, generation mutagenicity test, or productive cell in vivo mutagenicity test result. There is a positive result of the somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (chromosome aberration test on hamster bone marrow cells) indicated in DFGOT vol.9 (2003), and there besis no positive finding with the productive cell in vivo genotoxicity study. So it was classified as Category 2. O-body : Since there is no humans generation epidemiological information; negative result of generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal test on mouse) is indicated in DFGOT vol.9 (2003), and there is no positive result with the productive cell and the somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test. So it was classified as out of Category. S-body: No data.

toxic_to_reproduction.classification: Mixture: Classification not possible, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Mixture: no data. O-object: no data. S-object: no data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Mixture: Category 2, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Mixture : It was classified into Category 2 because that fetotoxicity (reduction of fetal weight, the increase in mortality rate, etc.) is observed, although it is small, skeletal abnormalities are also observed, but there is no description on general toxicity in parent animals in the rat and mouse administration examination of the abdominal cavity (DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.7, PDS (1987)). O-object: no data. S-object: no data.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Mixture: Category 1（nervous system）, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Mixture; It was set as Category 1 (nerve systems) based on the statement (DFGOT vol. 9(2003), PATTY (5th, 2001) vol.7, PDS (1987), ICSC (J) (2002), and HSDB (2005)) that significant reduction of plasma cholinesterase activity was acknowledged in terms of mixture for humans by the dosage of guidance value within the limits of Category 1, and that twitch, dizziness, closeness, feeling of sickness, vomited, miosis, muscle spasticity, the salivatsweating, and unconsciousness were seen by inhalation, and stomach cramps, diarrhea and vomiting were seen by intakes. O-body; There is no data. S-body; There is no data.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Mixture: Category 1（nervous system）, O-: Classification not possible, S-: Classification not possible
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Mixture: in rats, dogs, rabbits and guinea pigs, at the dosage of the guidance value range of Category 1, it is stated that inhibition of the cholinesterase activity inside of blood and in brain is observed, and toxic symptoms such as muscle fasciculation, debility, tremor, lacrimation, the salivation, dyspnea, nasal and mouth bubble, diarrhea, muscle paralysis, coma, and mild asphyxial convulsions were observed (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PDS (1987)). In humans, there is a statement that shows inhibition of plasma cholinesterase activity was observed (ACGIH (2002), DFGOT vol.9 (2003), PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.7). It was classified into Category 1 (nerve systems) based on these information. O-object: data not available. S-object: data not available.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=14.0microg/L of Crustacea (Water flea), and others (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, rapid degradability is unknown, though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=3.21 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
